meanings.definition: One who does not believe in a particular religious faith.
meanings.sent1: The unbeliever did not attend the church service.
meanings.sent2: She was considered an unbeliever because she did not follow any religion.
meanings.sent3: The unbeliever jokingly said they worshiped the sun instead of a god.
meanings.sent4: In a world of believers, he stood out like an unbeliever in a crowd of followers.
meanings.sent5: The unbeliever's lack of faith was as clear as day.

meanings.definition: A person who does not accept or have faith in something.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was seen as an unbeliever by those who believed in magic.
meanings.sent2: As an unbeliever in ghosts, she was not afraid of haunted houses.
meanings.sent3: The unbeliever refused to believe in luck, claiming hard work was the key to success.
meanings.sent4: To him, love was an illusion, making him an unbeliever in romance.
